page.title: 07SUTTON MILL DAM TODAY
page.content: The water in the dam is not used for industry any more. The whole area has been turned into a Nature Reserve. The Sutton Mill Dam has been bought by St. Helens Borough Council who have recognised its value for wildlife and as a place for everyone to enjoy. Through Operation Groundwork new footpaths are being made and many other improvements made to the area. A group called Sutton Mill Dam Action Group are helping the Groundwork Trust to introduce the improved area to children in the area. They and the rangers hope to tell everyone of the dangers of the dam but also of the many animals, birds and plants they can now see in the area. Swans and ducks can be seen on each visit. The dam is also now popular with fishermen.
